item.title: [RuneSource] Woodcutting
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:14, topic:439542”]If you want the proper animations for woodcutting, you can replace your hasAxeEquipped with this:

[code] private boolean hasAxeEquipped() {
int wcLvl = player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[Skill.WOODCUTTING]);
Container equip = player.getEquipment().getItemContainer();

	if (equip.contains(6739)) {
		if (wcLvl < 61) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 61 to use a dragon axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 3.05;
			animType = 2846;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1359)) {
		if (wcLvl < 41) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 41 to use a rune axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 2.2;
			animType = 867;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1357)) {
		if (wcLvl < 31) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 31 to use an adamant axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 1.65;
			animType = 869;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1355)) {
		if (wcLvl < 21) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 21 to use a mithril axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 1.2;
			animType = 871;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1361)) {
		if (wcLvl < 11) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 11 to use a black axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 0.75;
			animType = 873;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1353)) {
		if (wcLvl < 6) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 6 to use a steel axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 0.4;
			animType = 875;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1349)) { //iron axe
		axeInfluence = 0.15;
		animType = 877;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1351)) { //bronze axe
		axeInfluence = 0;
		animType = 879;
		return true;
	} else {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You must equip an axe to cut trees.");
		return false;
	}
}[/code]

Also add:
private int animType;
Right under
private int logType;

Then under startWoodcutting replace:
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(875, 0);
with
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation((animType), 0);

And do the same thing for public void execute()

[/quote]

Oh thanks, I was already wondering why my axe was looking steel all the time
“used to pEmote in Delta”

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Woodcutting
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

If you want the proper animations for woodcutting, you can replace your hasAxeEquipped with this:

[code] private boolean hasAxeEquipped() {
int wcLvl = player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[Skill.WOODCUTTING]);
Container equip = player.getEquipment().getItemContainer();

	if (equip.contains(6739)) {
		if (wcLvl < 61) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 61 to use a dragon axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 3.05;
			animType = 2846;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1359)) {
		if (wcLvl < 41) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 41 to use a rune axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 2.2;
			animType = 867;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1357)) {
		if (wcLvl < 31) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 31 to use an adamant axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 1.65;
			animType = 869;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1355)) {
		if (wcLvl < 21) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 21 to use a mithril axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 1.2;
			animType = 871;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1361)) {
		if (wcLvl < 11) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 11 to use a black axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 0.75;
			animType = 873;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1353)) {
		if (wcLvl < 6) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of at least 6 to use a steel axe.");
			return false;
		} else
			axeInfluence = 0.4;
			animType = 875;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1349)) { //iron axe
		axeInfluence = 0.15;
		animType = 877;
		return true;
	}
	else if (equip.contains(1351)) { //bronze axe
		axeInfluence = 0;
		animType = 879;
		return true;
	} else {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You must equip an axe to cut trees.");
		return false;
	}
}[/code]

Also add:
private int animType;
Right under
private int logType;

Then under startWoodcutting replace:
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(875, 0);
with
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation((animType), 0);

And do the same thing for public void execute()

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Woodcutting
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

dain bramage:

No no no no no! Use an event like system and why are you declaring constants IN methods? Not to mention, you’re hardcoding a lot. I know RuneSource is simplistic and was created to look like PI, but it should not be treated the same. Perhaps an enumeration would help out a bit… It’s nice to see people working on RuneSource though, and simply for that, I’d rep the hell out of you.

Still, he said he just started yesterday with Rune-Source, i think he deserves a little bit of credit

Read full topic
